Title: SETTING THE SCENE (PART I): USMNT's journey through WCQ to that historic moment
Description:
Front Row Soccer


					www.frontrowsoccer.com				

A funny thing happened to the U.S. in what they thought was going to be a 1-0 victory over Trinidad & Tobago on May 7, 1989.

Mike Windischmann captained the U.S. men's national team during World Cup qualifying for Italia 90 and the competition itself. (Michael Lewis/FrontRowSoccer.com)

Thirty-six years ago, Wednesday, on  Nov. 19, 1989, the U.S. men's national team, qualified for its first World Cup in 40 years by defeating host Trinidad & Tobago in the final qualifier for Italia 90. FrontRowSoccer.com editor Michael Lewis covered the game and sets the scene with this story.

By Michael Lewis

BigAppleSoccer.com Editor

A funny thing happened to the U.S. in what they thought was going to be a 1-0 victory over Trinidad & Tobago on May 7, 1989. They gave up the tying goal in the waning minutes, a goal that almost came back to haunt them. Instead of walking away with two points, the Americans had to split them with their rivals from the Caribbean.

The U.S. was clinging to a 1-0 lead behind a goal by defender Steve Trittischuh with two minutes left. U.S. forward Peter Vermes cleared the ball into the Trinidad half of the field. Trinidad's Brian Williams took control and knocked a long pass toward Hudson Charles, who ran into opened space, drawing defender Trittschuh with him.

Two players raced for the ball ‚Äì U.S. captain Mike Windischmann with an outstretched foot and Trinidad forward Marlon Morris, who got there first to gently head it to Charles, who had only goalkeeper Dvid Vanole to beat. No last-minute heroics this time.

‚ÄúWe kind of had a letdown,‚Äù Trittschuh said. ‚ÄúI don't know why. We weren't tired, but I could feel us letting down.‚Äù

It was still early and the U.S. got an opportunity to redeem itself against Guatemala in New Britain, Conn. on June 17 ‚Äì a 2-1 victory behind goals by Eric Eichmann and Bruce Murray.

‚ÄúYou could say it was huge,‚Äù said Vanole, explaining the importance of the match. ‚ÄúI think even if we had tied this game, it would have been disappointing.‚Äù

The victory left the U.S. with a 2-1-1 record and in second place in the tournament. Costa Rica (3-2-1, seven) led with Guatemala (1-2, two), Trinidad & Tobago (0-2-1, one) and El Salvador (0-0-0, 0) trailing.

Next up was El Salvador on July 9 (‚ÄúIt's going to be like hell going down to El Salvador in July,‚Äù U.S. forward Bruce Murray said) ‚Äì or so everyone thought.

The Americans' July 25 match in El Salvador was postponed until Sept. 17, to be played at a neutral site in Tegucigalpa, Honduras because of unruly fans stopped El Salvador's qualifier on June 25 with Costa Rica. The Ticos enjoyed a 4-2 advantage with six minutes remaining. Fans from the capacity crowd of 50,000 threw fruits, bottles and pennants onto the field to protest their team's poor performance.

Due to the postponement, head coach Bob Gansler was able to experiment with the lineup and decided to use 20-year-old Tony Meola, a University of Virginia sophomore in goal. Meola had acquitted himself well in the Marlboro Cup, an exhibition tournament, against the Peru national team and Benfica (Portugal). Meola, who eventually captured the Hermann Trophy as college soccer's top player in 1989, split his time between the national team and Virginia, helping the Cavaliers to a share of the NCAA Division I championship with Santa Clara in December.

Meola, an excellent ballhandler for a goalkeeper, could not, however, give the U.S. a needed lift offensively. The Americans did managed to get by El Salvador, 1-0, on a free kick by Perez.

The U.S. could not have planned the worst time for a scoring drought, playing host Guatemala on Oct. 8 and El Salvador at the St. Louis Soccer Park on Nov. 5 to back-to-back scoreless draws.

On Oct. 8, the U.S. outplayed Guatemala and had several serious scoring opportunities, but had trouble putting them away.

‚ÄúOur Achilles Heel showed again,‚Äù Gansler said. ‚ÄúWe had difficulty putting it in.‚Äù

The U.S. (3-1-2, eight) remained in third place behind Costa Rica (5-2-1, 11), which clinched a berth with the result, and Trinidad & Tobago 3-1-3, nine).

‚ÄúIt feels like a loss,‚Äù said Murray, who had two of the best scoring chances for the U.S. during a five-second span in the first half, but goalkeeper Ricardo Piccinini made a pair of bang-bang saves on point-blank shots. ‚ÄúI'm just disappointed. We came down to get two points and we didn't get them. We're going to need them for the stretch run.‚Äù

Meola agreed. ‚ÄúI'm as depressed as if we lost,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe most depressing thing about it was we have an incentive for Italia '90, they didn't.‚Äù

For a team eliminated in September and rebuilt within the past couple of weeks, Guatemala (1-4-1, three) acquitted itself quite well. There wasn't much local interest in this match, as one newspaper headlined the game ‚ÄúFutbol de la consolacion‚Äù ‚Äî consolation soccer.

Although ticket prices were as low as 80 cents, $2 and $3.20, a crowd of only 4,723 turned up at the 45,000 seat Estadio Nacional Mateo Flores that featured a field better suited for growing rice than playing soccer because of torrential rain the past several weeks.

It was more of the same against El Salvador at the St. Louis Soccer Park on Nov. 5. El Salvador, which had been eliminated, brought in what was an experimental team, played the Americans to a scoreless tie.

So, that set up THE GAME ‚Äî the deciding match in Port of Spain, Trinidad on Nov. 19.

Front Row Soccer editor Michael Lewis has covered 13 World Cups (eight men, five women), seven Olympics and 28 MLS Cups. He has written about New York City FC, New York Cosmos, the New York Red Bulls and both U.S. national teams and has penned a soccer history column for the Guardian.com. Lewis, who has been honored by the Press Club of Long Island and National Soccer Coaches Association of America, is the former editor of BigAppleSoccer.com. He has written seven books about the beautiful game and has published ALIVE AND KICKING The incredible but true story of the Rochester Lancers. It is available at Amazon.com.

Title: US Is Creating Priority Visa System For Football World Cup, Says Donald Trump
Description:
President Donald Trump said the US is creating a priority visa system for 2026 FIFA World Cup ticket holders, an effort to handle the large number of visitors expected for the soccer event.

Trump on Monday touted the creation of a "prioritised appointment scheduling system" which he said would allow World Cup ticket holders facing long wait-times for visas to speed up that process. 

Under the initiative, led by the US State Department, fans holding a ticket purchased through FIFA would get priority access to visa interviews, according to a release from the international soccer organisation. The priority interviews are expected to be available in early 2026.

The president said the departments of State and Homeland Security had worked to "ensure that soccer fans from all around the world are properly vetted and able to come to the United States next summer easily."

Next year's World Cup, the first hosted by three countries ‚Äì the US, Mexico and Canada ‚Äì offers to draw large numbers of spectators, including international fans, and deliver an economic windfall to host cities.

"I think safety and security is the number-one priority for a successful World Cup," said FIFA President Gianni Infantino, who joined Trump in the Oval Office Monday.

The president's comments followed a meeting of the White House task force on the World Cup, a group created to handle the logistical and security challenges surrounding the premier showcase for international soccer. The task force, established via executive order, is focused on coordinating various federal agencies in the planning, organisation and execution of the tournament. Trump installed himself as chair and Vice President JD Vance as vice chair, with Andrew Giuliani, son of ally Rudy Giuliani, as the executive director.

An avid sports fan who has already attended numerous premier sporting events since returning to office, Trump has involved himself in the planning, regularly touting the upcoming event. And FIFA has used the upcoming showcase for international soccer to expand its own footprint in the US.

While the president has said he will facilitate travel and visa access for World Cup teams, critics have expressed concerns that an immigration crackdown and efforts to expand federal policing of Democratically controlled cities will undermine that pledge. Last month, Trump threatened moving World Cup games out of Boston and the 2028 Olympics from Los Angeles if he thought the cities were not adequately prepared or if he deemed them unsafe.

Trump has also sparred with the other host nations over trade, and last month cut off talks with Canada after he was angered by an ad from Ontario's government targeting his tariff policies.

The president reiterated those threats on Monday and, when asked what his timeline would be for making such a decision, said that he would be willing to help cities that asked him for troops to maintain order.

"You know, the governors are going to have to behave. The mayors are going to have to behave. You know, in the case of California, you have a problem, you have high crime, then you have a place that just suffered great fires and everything else, and they didn't do a very good job," he added, referring to Los Angeles.

"I love Los Angeles. If they want help during this, I would love to send in National Guard or whoever is necessary to help them. I want it to be great. I'd love it to be in Los Angeles," Trump said.

Monday's task force meeting comes ahead of next month's draw to determine the match-ups for the tournament's group stage. The draw will be held at the Kennedy Center, another institution that Trump has sought to put his mark on. 

The US president has long had a warm relationship with FIFA's Infantino, hosting him at the White House multiple times and earlier this year attending the FIFA Club World Cup final at MetLife Stadium. 

FIFA opened an office in Trump Tower in June, with Eric Trump, executive vice-president of the Trump Organization and son of the US president, attending the event. That followed the 2024 opening of a FIFA office in Miami, Florida, which is home to the organisation's legal division.

Title: Trump calls Seattle Mayor-elect 'another beauty,' suggests World Cup games could be moved
Description:
Now

46¬∞

Wed

51¬∞

Thu

54¬∞

by KOMO News Staff

SEATTLE ‚Äî FIFA President Gianni Infantino and U.S. President Donald Trump unveiled an expedited visa process for World Cup ticket holders seeking entry into the United States, while the President made a veiled threat to Seattle as well.

Seattle is among the cities slated to host the 2026 World Cup, with six games planned. 

RELATED | President Trump suggests cities deemed unsafe could lose FIFA World Cup matches

During the announcement, Trump spoke about Seattle's new Democratic mayor-elect, Katie Wilson, and whether her agenda and the city's existing crime issues could impact its ability to host the games. 

Despite Infantino's reassurances, President Trump expressed concerns about potential issues in "liberal" cities, stating that if there is a "problem," he might consider relocating World Cup events from Seattle.



President Trump then redirected the question to Infantino did not directly answer, but said safety and security were FIFA's number one priority and noted that early ticket sales indicate fans are not currently concerned about it.

FIFA has contracts with 11 American cities and venues to host the games. The Trump administration has allocated $625 million to those cities for security and recently pledged to provide $500 million more for counter-drone defenses.

Infantino toured Seattle and the Sounders' Renton facility in October of 2024 and sang the praises of the facilities. FIFA also held multiple Club World Cup matches at Lumen Field this past summer, with no significant complaints.

The Seattle World Cup Organizing Committee said on Monday it was business as usual in planning for the event, noting that it had team members in DC last week. 

"We are working lockstep with the White House Task Force. We're working at every level of government, local, state, national, even international, on the border, to make sure this event comes off as the best event ever. And so we're super pleased with how it's all going," said Seattle World Cup Organizing Committee President Peter Tomozawa, who added that Wilson had pre-emptively reached out to his group to get more information and offer her excitement over hosting the global games.

Wilson's transition team pointed to a campaign statement in which she said she wanted the city to host an "awesome" World Cup and "This is a chance to make permanent upgrades to downtown public spaces and public transit, not just expensive, temporary improvements for the duration of the event."

‚ÄúPresident Trump's comments about moving the 2026 World Cup out of Seattle once again display his ignorance about our city and what we stand for," Seattle Mayor Bruce Harrell stated. "The safety of residents and visitors to Seattle is always a top concern of our administration. Violent crime is down 20%, homicides are down 42%, and shootings are down 29%." 

Harrell continued, "Seattle continues to attract major sporting, cultural, and music events, showing that visitors and organizers from around the world have confidence in our city. As a global destination for sports, we have been doing our part to prepare for a safe, welcoming, and fun experience for all who come to Seattle for matches. We are not going to be intimidated by political theatrics from the other Washington. Seattle leaders will continue to do the hard work necessary to create a safe, welcoming, and fun experience for residents and visitors alike.‚Äù

Visit Seattle, the city's tourism arm, also issued a statement: "We are thrilled to welcome soccer fans from around the world for FIFA World Cup 2026. Seattle ‚Äì and the greater state of Washington - is all in on creating a memorable World Cup experience. We are actively collaborating with local partners and law enforcement to deliver a safe and secure World Cup."

Washington Gov. Bob Ferguson also reacted with a statement, reading ‚ÄúSeattle will be an excellent host for the World Cup. My team has been working hard with the city of Seattle and our partners to make sure we're one of the best regions to host these games. I look forward to working with Mayor Wilson and her team. We're excited to share our city and our state with the world.‚Äù

Trump's full remarks on Seattle and Katie Wilson can be found starting at the 21-minute mark in the video below:



Wilson, who defines herself as a democratic socialist, won the Seattle mayoral race running on her platform of affordability, housing, homelessness, public safety, and transportation.

On her website, she highlights a plan for a "Trump-Proof Seattle," which aims to shield the city from potential federal rollbacks under a second Trump administration. 

SEE ALSO | Mayor-elect Katie Wilson urges unity, community, collective responsibility in Seattle

The proposal centers on protecting vulnerable communities, preserving essential services and reinforcing Seattle's progressive values in the face of national political shifts.

Wilson's plan acknowledges Seattle's reliance on roughly $150 million in annual federal funding and outlines a proactive strategy to close potential budget gaps with progressive local revenue sources. Among her proposals is the implementation of a city-level capital gains tax, a recommendation she helped develop during her tenure on the city's 2023 Revenue Stabilization Workgroup.



The mayor-elect also pledges to strengthen support for immigrants and refugees, expanding legal services, language access, and rapid-response tools for those facing immigration enforcement. She plans to update and reinforce Seattle's sanctuary city policies, ensuring that city departments, including the Seattle Police Department, do not cooperate with civil immigration arrests or share data with federal agencies.

Wilson's ‚ÄúTrump-Proof‚Äù agenda extends protections to the LGBTQ community and reproductive rights. She commits to safeguarding access to gender-affirming care and reproductive health services, ensuring shelters remain inclusive, and supporting schools in resisting federal pressure to retreat from inclusive practices.

Addressing concerns over government surveillance, Wilson plans to review how the city collects and stores data, especially any that could be accessed by hostile federal entities. She intends to strengthen surveillance ordinances and prevent SPD from using unapproved technologies acquired through other jurisdictions.

Framing her policy as both defensive and forward-looking, Wilson said Seattle must ‚Äúbuild resilient systems that protect our people and uphold our values‚Äù in uncertain national circumstances.

As for questions regarding Seattle's World Cup safety, the World Cup Organizing Committee and city leaders have already assured the public that there are multiple plans in place for maintaining a safe environment. 

These efforts include a focus on combating human trafficking with training for staff and workshops for businesses, and implementing traditional security measures like ticket checks and security perimeters. The  Organizing Committee is working with law enforcement and organizations like the Department of Homeland Security to create comprehensive plans. Plans also address concerns like drone threats and ensure security and safety drills are conducted. Organizers have also unrolled a detailed anti-human trafficking plan. 

LEARN MORE | World Cup Seattle security chief talks staging, safety at planned 2026 event

Violent crime rates per 100,000 people in each of the U.S host cities from 2024 can be found ranked below.

Figures that were calculated using the FBI's National Incident-Based Reporting System (NIBRS) are labeled with a ^ notation. Cities that could not be found under the NIBRS, are labeled with a * notation. Those figures were instead calculated using local data reports for violent crime in 2024 and population numbers.

More coverage on Seattle's World Cup preparations can be found HERE.

 2025 Sinclair, Inc.

Title: Carlo Ancelotti issues final warning to Neymar over Brazil World Cup spot as ex-Real Madrid boss aims to avoid any 'mistakes'
Description:
Carlo Ancelotti has issued a final warning to Neymar when it comes to 2026 World Cup selection, with the Italian tactician eager to ensure that he does not make any ‚Äúmistakes‚Äù when naming his final squad. Ancelotti has yet to call upon Neymar since becoming Selecao boss, but insists that the door remains open to the former Barcelona and Paris Saint-Germain superstar.

Neymar is his country's all-time leading scorer, with 79 goals being recorded across 128 appearances. He has not, however, pulled on a famous yellow jersey since October 2023 - when suffering knee ligament damage during a World Cup qualifying clash with Uruguay.

A long road to recovery was taken in on the back of that fitness blow, with his contract at Saudi Pro League side Al-Hilal eventually being terminated. That decision freed Neymar to head home and rejoin boyhood club Santos.

More fitness issues have been endured there, preventing the 33-year-old playmaker from convincing Ancelotti of his worth and earning an international recall. Neymar was overlooked again when Brazil named their squad for a friendly date with Tunisia that will take place in Lille, France.

Unsurprisingly, Ancelotti continues to be quizzed on whether an iconic No.10 forms part of his plans. He told reporters when discovering that the subject had followed him from South America to Europe: ‚ÄúI thought Neymar was just a topic in Brazil, but I see it's a global issue. Fortunately, he recovered from his injury. Now he has six months to play. The Brazilian Championship stops on December 7, then he can take a vacation, but then he'll have the Brazilian Championship again to show his quality and, obviously, his physical condition.‚Äù

Ancelotti went on to reveal that Neymar is in his thoughts when it comes to World Cup call-ups, but has pointed out that he will not be taking any risks when it comes to piecing together a squad to compete for global glory in the United States, Canada and Mexico.

He added: ‚ÄúNeymar is on the list of players who could be at the World Cup. Now he has six months to make the final list. We just have to observe him and other players so as not to make mistakes in the final list.‚Äù

Looking for smarter football bets? Get expert previews, data-driven predictions & winning insights with GOAL Tips on Telegram. Join our growing community now!

Ancelotti recently said of wanting to see more of Neymar at Santos in his favoured central playmaking berth: ‚ÄúI know everyone wants Neymar to get back to his best physical condition. And also the CBF, the coach, the technical staff of the national team hope that Neymar can return to his best level. The truth is that today's football demands many things. Not only talent, but also physical condition, intensity... hopefully Neymar will be at his best level.

‚ÄúI think he needs to play more centrally, not as a winger, because wingers in today's football are players you need to help defensively as well. When you play a little more centrally, the defensive work is much less than when you play as a winger. And I also think that a very talented player, closer to the goal, has more opportunities to score goals. [False 9] could be his ideal position.‚Äù

Neymar has taken in three appearances since returning from his latest injury - with his last seeing a shock victory picked up against Palmeiras that has helped to lift Santos out of the relegation zone.

Thigh problems have been an unfortunate theme over recent months, but Neymar does have six goals and three assists to his name through 24 appearances this season. More will be required in order to earn favour with Ancelotti, with there every chance that he will be plying his trade somewhere else when 2026 is welcomed in. That is because his contract continues to run down towards free agency, with a potential reunion with Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez at MLS side Inter Miami that would see Barcelona's fabled ‚ÄòMSN' strike force reformed continuing to be speculated on.

Title: Nico Paz is a magician! Como must not 'cage' star player who can pull a goal 'out of his hat', says coach Cesc Fabregas
Description:
Como coach Cesc Fabregas believes that Argentine midfielder Nico Paz should not be restricted, describing him as an incredible talent. The former Barcelona and Arsenal midfielder compared Paz to a magician on the pitch, saying he can pull a trick out of his hat at any moment, which is why he should never be ‚Äúcaged‚Äù.

Paz has quickly become one of Serie A's brightest young stars since joining from Real Madrid in 2024 for a fee of ‚Ç¨6 million (¬£5.2m/$6.9m). In his debut campaign, he delivered eight goals and six assists, earning the award for the league's best young player. His impact has only grown stronger this season, where he has already contributed four goals and four assists, showing remarkable consistency and maturity for his age.

A major reason for his rise has been his seamless fit in Fabregas' system. Fabregas has given him the freedom to dictate the tempo, find pockets of space, and drive the team forward, allowing Paz's intelligence and technical quality to shine. The coach has even placed him in the ‚ÄúLionel Messi category‚Äù in terms of how opponents react, noting that rival teams do everything they can to stop him from receiving the ball. Paz is now beginning to show that he can be a worthy successor to Messi in the national team as their primary creative force.

In an interview with La Provincia de Como, Como coach Fabregas praised Paz, saying the young midfielder does incredible things on the pitch, saying: ‚ÄúNico does incredible things. He is a footballer capable of pulling a trick out of his hat at any moment.‚Äù

Fabregas also highlighted Paz's versatility and unpredictable nature, explaining that his ability to attempt and execute crazy ideas makes him difficult to contain. For this reason, Fabregas believes Paz should not be restricted this season, adding: ‚ÄúHe does crazy things that are unpredictable, which is why he should not be caged.‚Äù

Looking for smarter football bets? Get expert previews, data-driven predictions & winning insights with GOAL Tips on Telegram. Join our growing community now!

Inter are preparing to make a major statement in the upcoming transfer window by submitting a ‚Ç¨58 million (¬£49m/$63m) bid for Paz. The club view the young midfielder as a long-term partner for Lautaro Martinez and believe his creativity and versatility would strengthen their attack for years to come. However, Inter face a significant obstacle in Madrid. The Spanish giants hold a buy back clause on Paz, reportedly valued at ‚Ç¨8 million in 2025, ‚Ç¨9 million in 2026 and ‚Ç¨10 million in 2027. This contractual leverage gives Madrid the power to either block the move or bring the player back at a fraction of Inter's proposed offer, complicating the Nerazzurri's ambitious pursuit.

Como President Mirwan Suwarso addressed Paz's transfer situation, explaining that Real Madrid are fully entitled to re-sign him based on the terms agreed in the original deal. He made it clear that the club respects the arrangement and that the player's future remains his own choice. Suwarso said: ‚ÄúI couldn't care less. It's a situation we agreed on from the beginning. Real Madrid are allowed to buy him back whenever they want. It's up to Nico to decide what he wants to do with his future. We are very happy to have him. We like to build a home for him in Como. He chose to stay this season, and we take it day by day. We see how it goes. Does he go back to Madrid next season? Madrid have every right to do that. Will he stay with us? It's up to him whether he wants it or not.‚Äù

Paz has been central to Como's impressive campaign, with the club currently sitting seventh and pushing for European qualification. His performances have directly contributed to key results, including a memorable win over Juventus and a hard-fought draw against defending champions Napoli. With Paz in strong form, Fabregas will aim to shape his system around maximising the midfielder's impact, ensuring he remains the driving force behind Como's pursuit of a historic finish.

Title: United Cup 2026 draw revealed
Description:
The world's best tennis players are set for some blockbuster match-ups at the fourth edition of the United Cup, the innovative mixed team event in Perth and Sydney from Friday 2 to Sunday 11 January 2026.

Eighteen countries were drawn into six groups of three teams at the official draw today.

Icons of the game, Wally Masur and Jelena Dokic were on hand for the proceedings, while Casey Dellacqua and Matt Ebden attended the United Cup draw event at RAC Arena in Perth.

Perth

Defending champions Team USA and top seeds headline Group A and will return to Perth in 2026. Led by world No.3 Coco Gauff and world No.6 Taylor Fritz, USA will go head-to-head with Spain and Argentina in the group stage.

Third seeds Team Italy, guided by world No.8 and 2024 Roland Garros and Wimbledon finalist Jasmine Paolini and rising star Flavio Cobolli will meet Team France and Team Switzerland's Stan Wawrinka and world No.11 Belinda Bencic in Group C.

Team Great Britain, featuring a fresh line-up including world No.10 Jack Draper and 2021 US Open champion Emma Raducanu, will headline Group E alongside Team Greece's Stefanos Tsitsipas and Maria Sakkari and debutant's Team Japan led by four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka and 2019 Junior Wimbledon champion Shintaro Mochizuki.

Sydney

World No.5 Felix Auger-Aliassime and teenage talent Victoria Mboko top Group B in Sydney as the No.2 seeds in the competition in 2026. They will face Team Belgium and Team China.

Group D will feature Team Australia led by world No.7 Alex de Minaur and the nation's new top-ranked woman, world No.32 Maya Joint. Team Czechia and Casper Ruud's Team Norway complete the group.

United Cup 2024 champions Team Germany, led by world No.3 Alexander Zverev and debutant Eva Lys will star in Group F, alongside Poland's world No.2 Iga Swiatek and Hubert Hurkacz and Team Netherlands.

United Cup Tournament Director Stephen Farrow said the draw for 2026 will see some of the biggest names in tennis play the United Cup this summer.

‚ÄúWe're extremely proud of this competition for what it represents and celebrates, the fact that our great sport of tennis is played by so many amazing athletes on both the female and male side of the sport,‚Äù Farrow said.

‚ÄúTo bring those athletes together to play for not just big ranking points and prize money but for their country and national pride is what makes this competition so special.

‚ÄúIt's an intense and exciting atmosphere with loads of fans coming to watch. Some of the top players in the world, truly engaged and wanting to win out there on court in Perth and Sydney. We have a huge amount to look forward to in January.‚Äù

Western Australian Tourism Minister the Hon. Reece Whitby MLA said: ‚ÄúWe are absolutely delighted to welcome such a talented lineup of tennis teams to Western Australia. I'm extremely excited we'll be hosting USA and Italy for massive tennis matches that will serve up another incredible year of major events for the State.

‚ÄúEvents like the United Cup build on WA's status as a premier destination for major sporting events, spotlighting our vibrant capital city in the beautiful summertime.

‚ÄúReturning for a fourth year, the United Cup is a fantastic event that forms part of our economic diversification strategy to draw visitors to our State and inject millions of valuable tourism dollars providing a boost to local business and jobs.‚Äù

NSW Minister for Sport and Minister for Jobs and Tourism Steve Kamper added, ‚ÄúAs the host city of the tournament's biggest matches, the United Cup is one of the most anticipated events in Sydney's packed summer of sport, offering fans a rare opportunity to watch the world's best tennis players compete for their country.

‚ÄúThe electric atmosphere of Ken Rosewall Arena created by passionate fans from across the globe is a truly unique experience that will again showcase Sydney as one of the world's great stages for international sport.‚Äù

The tournament schedule will be released tomorrow, Tuesday 18 November. Group stage tickets will go on sale from 12.00pm local time Wednesday 19 November in Perth and Sydney. Adult tickets start from $40 and from $20 for children 3-12 years of age.

Title: Bill Maher Reveals Why He Quit Stand-Up Comedy: ‚ÄúIt's A Good Time To Not Be Out There‚Äù
Description:
By Denise Petski 

Senior Managing Editor


Bill Maher is putting a pause on stand-up comedy, and one of his reasons is due to the intense political division in the country. 


	Maher told Patton Oswalt on his Club Random podcast Monday that he decided to stop touring at the end of 2024 because, ‚ÄúI don't want to be out there in this country, in this political atmosphere. I could get shot by the left or the right,‚Äù adding ‚ÄúIts a good time not to be out there.‚Äù He did acknowledge though, that there are other reasons. He said he was ‚Äútired of the travel,‚Äù and ‚ÄúI just got tired of being twice as funny as people who were selling twice as many tickets as me.‚Äù

	











	
	
		
					Related Stories		
	













	News
	



	
		
					"Quiet, Piggy": Donald Trump Lashes Out At Female Reporter Who Asked About Jeffrey Epstein Files		
			















	News
	



	
		
					Appeals Court Rejects Donald Trump's Attempt To Revive Lawsuit Against CNN		
			








	‚ÄúNot that I didn't sell a lot of tickets and do great theaters ‚Äî but I didn't sell arenas,‚Äù Maher added. ‚ÄúAnd some people did, who, frankly, are not that great. But, you know, when the audience is 35 to 45, they don't wanna see somebody 70‚Ä¶ I just did my 13th HBO special. I feel like that's a good body of work‚Ä¶ I felt they all, they basically got better as it went along. I feel like the last one was the best one, which is a good way to get off.‚Äù




			Watch on Deadline		







	Maher has taken heat over the years from both the left and right over his contrarian views, but the criticism intensified on the left when he had dinner with Donald Trump earlier this year at the White House. He insisted he ‚Äúdidn't go MAGA,‚Äù and he defended his decision to meet with Trump. 


	‚ÄúLemme first say to all of the people who treated this like it was some kind of summit meeting, you're ridiculous‚Ä¶ like I was gonna sign a treaty or something,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI have no power, I'm a f‚Äîing comedian, and he's the most powerful leader in the world.‚Äù

Title: Michael B. Jordan & Juno Temple Join Animated Feature ‚ÄòSwapped'
Description:
By Zac Ntim 

International Reporter


Michael B. Jordan and Juno Temple will star in the animated feature Swapped, directed by Nathan Greno (Tangled), for Netflix and Skydance Animation.


	The film's screenplay was written by John Whittington, Christian Magalhaes, and Robert Snow. The story is by John Whittington, Adam Karp, Christian Magalhaes and Robert Snow, and Nathan Greno. 


	The official synopsis reads: A buddy comedy about a small woodland creature (voiced by Michael B. Jordan) and a majestic bird (voiced by Juno Temple)‚Äînatural sworn enemies of The Valley‚Äîwho suddenly swap bodies and must team up (while walking in each other's feathers and fur) to survive the wildest adventure of their lives.

	











	‚ÄúSwapped is an unpredictable, emotional ride ‚Äî full of humor, spectacle, and heart. We drew from live-action nature documentaries, exploring the complexity of a wild ecosystem to capture something that feels vibrant and deeply human,‚Äù Greno said in a statement. 




			Watch on Deadline		







	‚ÄúMichael B. Jordan and Juno Temple brought such warmth and authenticity to the film. Every moment between them feels alive ‚Äî funny one second, deeply moving the next. Their chemistry lifts the story and gives Swapped its wings.‚Äù


	Producers on the film are John Lasseter, David Ellison, Dana Goldberg, and Mary Ellen Bauder Andrews.

Title: Teyana Taylor's daring Elle Women in Hollywood dress is basically a hood attached to a skirt
Description:
Teyana Taylor was honored at Monday night's Elle Women in Hollywood event, wearing a gold look that included little more than a skirt and a hood.

Crafted in a lustrous metallic fabric, Taylor's Balmain outfit featured a gathered skirt that was accented by a belt at her thighs. The rest of the dress was basically just a hood, with one long piece of the shiny material traveling up from the belt and around the top of her head. 

A rippling layer of fabric was precariously placed on her chest to avoid any unwanted wardrobe malfunctions, showing off her sternum tattoo and navel piercing while leaving her back totally exposed.  

She stacked chunky gold rings on her fingers and wore artistic gold drop earrings in a warm hue similar to her dress.

Her gathered skirt exposed her ankle, showing off gold high-heeled sandals that snaked their way up her calves.  

The dress was presented as part of Olivier Rousteing's Resort 2026 collection back in June. It was one of his final collections for the house, following the announcement that Antonin Tron would be replacing him at the helm.

Holding the latest iPhone, she chatted with Elle on the red carpet about her obsession with a wallet phone case; her dress had no room for pockets.

‚ÄúI don't like carrying purses. One thing I'm never going to do is lose my phone. I will lose a purse, I will lose a diamond ring, I will lose a chain, I will lose earrings ‚Ä¶ but I ain't gonna lose my phone.‚Äù

Taylor has just concluded a whirlwind press tour for her latest Hulu show, ‚ÄúAll's Fair,‚Äù where the group certainly brought the jaw-dropping fashion, which the actress happily continued through this event last night.

Title: Liev Schreiber's Fans Send Prayers After His Hospitalization
Description:
Fans feared the worst when it was announced on Monday, November 17, that beloved actor Liev Schreiber had been hospitalized in New York City. Now, they are sending him their prayers and hoping for a speedy recovery. 

Schreiber's most recent Instagram post was on November 17. It is a post he was tagged in for his work on a new project, ‚ÄúCreditors.‚Äù ‚ÄúAt a secluded seaside hotel, Adi (@standup4justice), a struggling painter, finds his creative spark reignited by Gustav (@lievschreiber), a magnetic stranger,‚Äù the caption reads. ‚ÄúTheir connection is instant and consuming, but what begins as a chance encounter twists into something far darker when Gustav becomes intrigued by Adi's wife, the dazzling Tekla (Maggie Siff).‚Äù

‚ÄúCreditors‚Äù is Jen Silverman's adaptation of August Strindberg's work, the caption states. The post has been used to generate excitement and tease the project.  Although this post has nothing to do with Schreiber's health update, fans have taken to the comment section to express their concerns and to send the actor their love and prayers. 

‚ÄúI read you got hospitalized! Hit me! You are my absolute favorite actor! Please, get Well soon. Lots of love and greets from germany!‚Äù a comment reads. Other reactions include, ‚ÄúSending love and prayers from Texas!!! Feel better soon,‚Äù ‚ÄúHoping you feel better soon,‚Äù and ‚ÄúPraying for you.‚Äù

The good news is that Schreiber is back to work and has been discharged from the hospital. He had been hospitalized after he experienced an excruciating headache. His doctor had suggested he go to the hospital to get checked out. It was there that he underwent a ‚Äúbattery of tests,‚Äù TMZ reports. 

Schreiber's rep later updated the publication with a statement about his health. ‚ÄúOut of an abundance of caution, Liev went into the hospital for testing and as of this afternoon, he has been cleared to return to work,‚Äù his rep said, TMZ reports. 

Despite this positive update, it remains unclear which symptoms the actor had and which tests he underwent. ‚ÄúOur sources say doctors don't know the nature of the problem, but we're told Liev is able to speak and walk without any issues and has the full use of his limbs,‚Äù TMZ reported at the time of the initial hospitalisation.

Schreiber has not offered his fans reassurance yet with a statement or post on social media, but the fact that he has been discharged from hospital will come as a sigh of relief to many. 

I am no doctor,but sounds like the hemiplegic migraines my daughter has suffered from. They are incredibly scary headaches that come on strong,fast and include stroke-like symptoms. I am glad to hear he is doing better.

Title: Kevin Hart's Lifelong Friend & Tour Manager Tragically Passes Away
Description:
Kevin Hart is mourning the loss of his dear friend Nate Smith, who served as his tour manager before his passing.

Hart, 46, often shared hilarious anecdotes of his life with his late pal throughout his standup career. 

The ‚ÄúJumanji‚Äù star took to social media on Monday, November 17, to announce the devastating news. 

‚ÄúI lost a dear friend today,‚Äù Hart began in a post shared via Instagram. ‚ÄúNate you are a legend in this game of comedy‚Ä¶. I am honored to have been able to call you my road manager.‚Äù

He continued, ‚ÄúYou taught me so much about this business‚Ä¶ ur loyalty and dedication was unmatched‚Ä¶. U had a heart of gold man‚Ä¶. Sometimes misunderstood by some but never by me.‚Äù

Hart went on to thank Smith for his years of friendship.

‚ÄúThank you for all that u did ‚Ä¶. I love you for life man. You will be missed. RIP NATE‚Ä¶. One of the best to ever do it!!!!! Love u.‚Äù

Fans of the comedian were quick to flood the comments section with thoughts and prayers for Hart and his late friend, as many felt a connection to Smith due to his constant presence in Hart's sets.

‚ÄúI remember watching this, wishing him peace üïäÔ∏è‚Äù one fan commented. 

‚ÄúI'm so sorry Kev, keep keeping his memory alive the way you do. Love and peace to you and yours. ü§ç‚Äù another wrote. 

‚ÄúPrayers for you, Nate and those who love him üòá ü´Ç‚Äù a third follower added. 

The ‚ÄúNight School‚Äù actor often told stories of his relationship with Smith, including in his 2010 comedy special, ‚ÄúSeriously Funny.‚Äù

‚ÄúMy road manager and I are very close,‚Äù Hart began to a roaring audience. ‚ÄúHe's older. We fight a lot, though. It's kinda like a relationship. He's been around me for years. He was with me before money even came into the picture. He's the one scrambling up for me. But when you're around somebody for so long, naturally you start to butt heads. Little [expletive] annoys you.‚Äù

He then delivered the punchline, ‚ÄúI don't like the way he sneezes‚Ä¶ I never saw nobody catch they breath from a sneeze.‚Äù

Smith stayed by Hart's side throughout his career, and the actor showed his appreciation in 2018 by gifting his friend a vintage car. 

‚ÄúMy Road Manager of 12yrs Nate Smith walked into his home and found a nice surprise in his garage. We argue like cats and dogs but ur loyalty has never been in question,‚Äù Hart captioned a video of the sweet moment. ‚ÄúI love your old ass man‚Ä¶.Thank you for your help in making another tour a major success!!!!‚Äù

To have had this admiration and respect for someone is so tellin.

Title: ‚ÄòSister Wives' Star Reveals Tragic Personal Loss
Description:
‚ÄúSister Wives‚Äù star Janelle Brown recently suffered a devastating personal loss with the passing of her beloved friend Angela Moody. 

Moody was seen in the Sunday, November 16, episode of the TLC series. During the closing credits, however, the show revealed her passing with a tribute that read, ‚ÄúIn memory of Angela Moody.‚Äù

Janelle, who separated from husband Kody Brown in December 2023, explained that it was difficult for her to make friends in Flagstaff, Arizona, after the family relocated from Las Vegas. 

‚ÄúI struggled for years to find friends in Flagstaff, and then I finally found them about a year or so before I moved away,‚Äù she said during a confessional during Sunday's episode. 

Following her split, Janelle moved from the family home in Arizona to North Carolina with her daughter and grandchildren. 

In the recent episode, she returned to Arizona to finalize the sale of her portion of Coyote Pass ‚Äî land purchased by the family with the intent to build a compound. 

She was seen enjoying a girls' lunch with Angela and pal Kristina as the ladies gossiped about Kody. 

Fans were shocked to learn of Angela's passing just moments lady. 

While Angela's cause of death was not revealed publicly, her daughter, Taylor Reinoso, explained that she passed away ‚Äúunexpectedly.‚Äù

‚ÄúMy mom was the heart of our home, always cooking healthy homemade meals, keeping things organized, and making sure everyone was cared for. She was a constant source of comfort, strength, and love for our family,‚Äù Taylor shared in a GoFundMe set up to help raise funds of Angela's husband, Craig, and their minor son Isaac. 

Angela passed away suddenly on October 1. She was just 51 years old.

Janelle took to Instagram on Sunday to share her feelings about friendship. 

‚ÄúI've been thinking a lot lately about friendships in this stage of life. Honestly, it wasn't until I read Mel Robbins' ‚ÄúLet Them‚Äù that I fully understood how much our friendships are shaped by shared life stages and what I call being ‚Äòin the same neighborhood,' not literally, but emotionally. Walking through the same seasons at the same time,‚Äù she captioned a series of friendly photos. 

‚ÄúI found a few amazing women who went out of their way to make me feel like I had community again,‚Äù she continued. ‚ÄúBut it felt so akward in the early stages of getting acquainted . Building that friendship. And I learned another important thing , friendships outside of ‚Äòthe neighborhood' take intention.‚Äù

Title: Liev Schreiber Hospitalized in New York City: Report
Description:
Liev Schreiber is recovering in a New York City hospital after a sudden health scare sent him in for urgent medical care, as reported by TMZ.

Sources told TMZ the ‚ÄúRay Donovan‚Äù star developed a massive headache on Sunday and immediately called his doctor, who told him to go to the hospital at once. The report states that the Emmy-nominated actor followed that advice and stayed overnight as doctors began evaluating him.

Sources say Schreiber spent Monday undergoing a battery of tests as doctors try to determine what caused the episode. The exact issue remains unclear. Doctors have not yet identified the source of the problem, but Schreiber has remained alert and mobile. He can walk, speak, and move without difficulty, and he has full use of his limbs.

Despite the uncertainty, Schreiber's condition appears stable. Those close to him say the actor has remained communicative as doctors continue diagnostic scans and examinations.

The urgency of Sunday's symptoms prompted immediate action, allowing doctors to begin treating and monitoring him.

In April 2024, the Tony-winning actor opened up about a frightening medical emergency he experienced during his Broadway run in ‚ÄúDoubt: A Parable.‚Äù 

Appearing on ‚ÄúLate Night with Seth Meyers,‚Äù the 56-year-old described a sudden, crushing headache that hit backstage before he walked out to perform. 

People quoted the actor saying: ‚ÄúThe worst nightmare that an actor could possibly ever experience,‚Äù he said, recalling how he couldn't remember his costar Amy Ryan's name and then blanked on the play entirely once he stepped into the spotlight. ‚ÄúIt all vanishes. The play is gone from my head ‚Ä¶ I know I'm in a play, but I don't know what play I'm in,‚Äù he shared.

Seeing the fear on his doctor's and wife's faces, he assumed he had suffered a stroke. 

An MRI later cleared him, and a neurologist diagnosed him with transient global amnesia, a condition he joked can follow ‚Äúmigraines and rigorous coitus.‚Äù

Schreiber is a father of three children. He shares his son, Sasha, and daughter, Kai, 16, with ex-partner Naomi Watts. He also has a daughter, Hazel Bee, 2, with his wife, Taylor Neisen. An official statement has not yet been issued about his health emergency. 

Latest Update: (9:07 pm ET)

Liev's rep told TMZ that Schreiber  went to the hospital ‚Äúout of an abundance of caution‚Äù and has now been cleared. ‚ÄúOut of an abundance of caution, Liev went into the hospital for testing and as of this afternoon, he has been cleared to return to work,‚Äù the statement read.

This is a developing story, and it will be updated as more information becomes available.

Title: Last Night's Knockouts: Videos of Each Performance & Who's in 'The Voice' Season 28 Playoffs
Description:
During another night of powerful performances on November 17, 2025, the Knockouts continued on season 28 of ‚ÄúThe Voice.‚Äù Below you'll find videos of each featured artist during week four of the Knockouts, including the latest ‚ÄúMic Drop‚Äù recipient, and details on who's moving on to the Playoffs.

The night started with two of Reba McEntire's country artists duking it out onstage ‚Äî rural Minnesota's Cori Kennedy and Aaron Nichols of Bakersfield, California. Nichols kicked things off playing his electric guitar on a rousing rendition of The Band of Heathens' ‚ÄúHurricane.‚Äù 

During rehearsals, Kennedy told McEntire and Mega Mentor Joe Walsh of the Eagles that she'd never played with a full band backing her until making it onto ‚ÄúThe Voice.‚Äù So she decided to take advantage of the opportunity by breaking out of her country wheelhouse to do a rock version of Lady Gaga's ‚ÄúYou and I.‚Äù 

The coaches loved both artists' performances, but McEntire decided to move forward with ‚ÄúAaron Cold as an Icicle Nichols,‚Äù as Snoop Dogg nicknamed him due to his vocal ‚Äúcontrol‚Äù and ‚Äúgrit.‚Äù McEntire called Kennedy a ‚Äúpowerhouse,‚Äù but said Nichols' years of performing in Nashville had paid off in his onstage presence. 

He even received McEntire's coveted ‚ÄúMic Drop,‚Äù which means he'll be one of four artists (one from each team) that viewers will vote on to determine which singer will get to perform during the Rose Bowl Parade on New Year's Day.

Nineteen-year-old Carolina Rodriguez had her first mentoring session with Snoop (and his Mega Mentor Zac Brown), since he stole her from coach Niall Horan during the Battles. For the Knockouts, the Miami native sang Adele's version of The Cure's ‚ÄúLove Song‚Äù because the song reminds her of her siblings, who've supported her dreams unconditionally. 

Maryland's Mindy Miller, 35, told Snoop and Brown that she decided to sing Jamey Johnson's ‚ÄúIn Color,‚Äù calling it ‚Äúone of the finest pieces of storytelling in music.‚Äù Miller tearfully said she was dedicating her performance to her grandparents, who lived across the street from her as she was growing up and ‚Äútaught me so much about music and life and love.‚Äù 

Though Snoop told Rodriguez she was ‚Äúamazing,‚Äù especially at her age, he decided to move forward with Miller, whom he said ‚Äútouched my heart tonight, and that's what music is supposed to do.‚Äù 

Michael Bubl√© brought Latin singer Teo Ramdell and soul singer Jazz McKenzie together for his latest Knockout. Ramdell decided not to sing in Spanish this time, opting for Bon Jovi's ‚ÄúIt's My Life.‚Äù McKenzie, meanwhile, decided to sing Smokey Robinson's ‚ÄúCruisin.'‚Äù

Snoop told Ramdell that his singing and moves onstage was ‚Äúsuperstar stuff.‚Äù Their coach told Ramdell he knew how hard he worked on the Bon Jovi song, but he chose to move ahead with McKenzie, whom he told, ‚ÄúGod's light radiates through you.‚Äù 

The final round of the Knockouts airs on November 24 at 9 p.m. Eastern time.

Title: ‚ÄòA Poet' Trailer: Colombia's Oscar Entry Is a Hilariously Caustic Character Study in Daniel Clowes Mode
Description:
By providing your information, you agree to our Terms of Use and our Privacy Policy.
				We use vendors that may also process your information to help provide our services. This site is protected by reCAPTCHA Enterprise and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.

Colombia's Oscar entry ‚ÄúA Poet‚Äù is one of the most bruisingly funny contenders in this year's Best International Feature lineup, but it still packs plenty of art. Writer/director Sim√≥n Mesa Soto directs first-time actor Ubeimar Rios, whose obsession with poetry in a literary industry bent more toward spectacle has turned him into the stereotypical tortured artist. Until he meets a teenage protege who turns his life well, not quite around, but certainly upside down.

Distributor 1-2 Special is set to release the film, which won the Cannes Un Certain Regard Jury Prize earlier this year, in January. The film's caustic humor centered around a sad-sack protagonist whose pratfalls recall the work of graphic novelist Daniel Clowes or, more recently, Owen Kline's A24 movie ‚ÄúFunny Pages.‚Äù

 








Related Stories ‚ÄòWicked: For Good' Review: The Finale of a Needlessly Two-Part Movie Musical Adaptation Doesn't Go Out on a High Note ‚ÄòThe Chronology of Water' Trailer: Kristen Stewart Makes Directorial Debut with Character Study of a Troubled Swimmer 

Below, IndieWire debuts the exclusive trailer ahead of preliminary shortlist voting ‚Äî which includes Best International Feature, Best Documentary, and more categories ‚Äî which begins December 8. The shortlists will be announced Tuesday, December 16. (See our Academy Awards predictions here.)

 











			Popular on IndieWire		






Here's the synopsis courtesy of 1-2 Special: ‚ÄúMiddle-aged and erratic, Oscar is a failed writer who has given up on life. Unemployed and living with family, he wanders the streets of Medell√≠n in a drunken stupor, lamenting the state of literature in his home country, where he has succumbed to the clich√© of the tortured artist. However, the opportunity to mentor a young student offers a chance at redemption, if he doesn't screw it up first. In a performance marked by darkly comic pathos, first-time actor Ubeimar Rios stars in Sim√≥n Mesa Soto's Un Certain Regard Jury Prize-winner ‚ÄòA Poet,' a raw and riotous farce about how good deeds are often met with the universe's idea of cruel and unusually poetic punishment.‚Äù

More on the film from IndieWire's Critic's Pick review out of Cannes from Ben Croll: ‚ÄúPut together with impressive efficiency ‚Äî the film only started shooting in January ‚Äî this art-world send-up explores the many fears and frustrations the acclaimed director felt in the decade since making the 2014 short film Palme d'Or winner ‚ÄòLeidi,' channeling them into a darkly-funny burlesque that speaks of verse while playing like a Dan Clowes comic brought to manic life‚Ä¶ The film's bawdy sense of humor plays off a non-professional star ‚Äî himself a full-time teacher from a nearby school ‚Äî that looks like he was drawn by Robert Crumb and acts the part just as well.‚Äù

 










‚ÄúA Poet‚Äù opens in select theaters January 30, 2026, from 1-2 Special. Other recent and upcoming releases from the distributor include Harris Dickinson's ‚ÄúUrchin,‚Äù Radu Jude's ‚ÄúDracula,‚Äù Christian Petzold's ‚ÄúMiroirs No. 3,‚Äù and Mark Jenkin's ‚ÄúRose of Nevada.‚Äù

Title: Jimmy Kimmel Returns to Air After Death of Friend and Bandleader Cleto Escobedo III
Description:
By 

	Jon Blistein



Jimmy Kimmel returned to the airwaves Monday, Nov. 17, after taking several days off following the death of his longtime friend and Jimmy Kimmel Live bandleader, Cleto Escobedo III.


	Escobedo died suddenly on Nov. 11, with a cause of death later revealed to be cardiogenic shock following complications related to a liver transplant. Kimmel went ahead with his show that day, delivering an emotional tribute to Escobedo during his monologue, before taking the rest of the week off to grieve.


	On last night's show, Kimmel didn't directly address Escobedo's death. But there was one notable change, with announcer Lou Wilson tweaking the house band's name from Cleto and the Cletones to just the Cletones. 


	As Kimmel recalled in his monologue last week, he met Escobedo not long after his family moved from Brooklyn to Las Vegas. ‚ÄúWe became friends. And not just regular friends,‚Äù Kimmel said. ‚ÄúWe became like 24/7, ‚ÄòMom please let me sleep over please,' kind of friends.‚Äù 

	











	Escobedo was a gifted saxophone player and spent time touring with Paula Abdul, Marc Anthony, and Cecilia No√´l. When Kimmel was offered the chance to do his own late-night show, he immediately knew he wanted Escobedo to be his bandleader. ‚ÄúWe grew up watching Dave and Paul, and the idea that anyone other than him would lead the band was terrifying,‚Äù Kimmel said, referring to David Letterman and his longtime bandleader Paul Shaffer. ‚ÄúIt had to be him.‚Äù 


	Kimmel went on to call Escobedo the ‚Äúnicest, most humble, kind, and always funny person,‚Äù adding: ‚ÄúHe loved me. He loved seeing all of this happen. He loved being a part of it. He never took it for granted‚Ä¶ He was just a great older brother. No baggage, all love. There's no one in my life I felt more comfortable with.‚Äù

	











	
		Trending Stories
	
	






	
	
		
					Elon Musk Fires Back After Billie Eilish Calls Him a ‚ÄòCoward' for Wealth Hoarding		
	









	
	
		
					Jon Stewart Questions Trump References in Epstein Emails: ‚ÄòWhich Bubba Was He Blowing?'		
	









	
	
		
					Selena Quintanilla's Autopsy Report Revealed 30 Years After Her Death		
	









	
	
		
					‚ÄòWeird Al' Yankovic Announces 90-Date ‚ÄòBigger & Weirder' 2026 Tour		
	









Speaking with Rolling Stone, Escobedo's bandmate, the keyboardist and musical arranger Jeff Babko, said, ‚ÄúI don't think I've ever seen television like Jimmy's monologue the other night. It was something else. We were all feeling a lot, and I think it really showed what kind of family Jimmy created over there. If it's not legit blood family, it's one step removed. It's pretty deep. And with Cleto gone, it's all hitting hard. These events ‚Äî the good ones and the bad ones ‚Äî show our little show-family at its closest.‚Äù


	Over the weekend, Kimmel launched two fundraisers in Escobedo's memory. One was for UCLA Medical Center, where Escobedo was being treated, and the other was for the Animal Foundation in Las Vegas, in honor of Escobedo's love of animals and rescue dogs.

Title: Swifties and AI Chatbots Inspire Cambridge Dictionary to Make 'Parasocial' the Word of the Year
Description:
By 

	Larisha Paul



	Cambridge Dictionary defines ‚ÄúParasocial‚Äù as ‚Äúinvolving or relating to a connection that someone feels between themselves and a famous person they do not know, a character in a book, film, TV series, etc., or an artificial intelligence.‚Äù It can now also be defined as the dictionary's 2025 Word of the Year, thanks, at least in part, to Taylor Swift‚Äòs engagement to Travis Kelce, streamer iShowSpeed blocking an overzealous fan, and widespread controversies involving AI chatbots.


	‚ÄúAs social media intensifies the intimacy that fans feel with their adored celebrities, and with the rise in popularity of AI companions that can take on personalities, the word for these one-way relationships ‚Äì parasocial ‚Äì is having its own moment,‚Äù Cambridge Dictionary wrote in an overview of the term's development in culture throughout the year. 


	According to the report, searches for ‚Äúparasocial‚Äù spiked in June when iShowSpeed ‚Äî named Rolling Stone's most influential creator of 2025 ‚Äî blocked a fan account on X that published an extensive thread about his past relationship. The compilation of posts made assumptions about the streamer's private life, what his family thought of his former partner, and more boundary-crossing observations shared as fact. When iShowSpeeed blocked the account, which identified as his ‚Äúnumber 1 parasocial,‚Äù the user behind it pleaded, ‚ÄúI'll delete the tweet please unblock me I've dead been shaking non stop please I'll stop.‚Äù

	











	Another spike came in August, when Swift and Kelce announced their engagement after two years of dating. ‚ÄúYour English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married,‚Äù the couple wrote in a joint post on Instagram. It playfully reflected the personal relationship some Swifties feel towards the musician, having been on a journey through the highs and lows of her past relationships by way of her music for nearly two decades. ‚ÄúTaylor Swift is engaged and I've never felt more parasocial over someone,‚Äù one viral post read. Other fans shared videos of themselves crying tears of joy, while people who have convinced themselves that Swift is secretly gay pushed more conspiracy theories. 

	











	
		Editor's picks
	
	











	
	
		
					The 250 Greatest Albums of the 21st Century So Far		
	














	
	
		
					The 100 Best TV Episodes of All Time		
	














	
	
		
					The 500 Greatest Albums of All Time		
	














	
	
		
					100 Best Movies of the 21st Century		
	









	That same month, attorneys general from 44 states signed an open letter warning AI companies about the dangers of ‚Äúchatbot parasocial relationships,‚Äù particularly as they relate to children. This came after internal reports from Meta that coding in its AI technology on Facebook allowed for chatbots to ‚Äúengage a child in conversations that are romantic or sensual,‚Äù per Reuters. As the year progressed, AI programs, including OpenAI's ChatGPT and Character Technologies' Character.ai, among others, were linked to harrowing instances of self-harm and suicide in young users.





	
		Trending Stories
	
	






	
	
		
					Elon Musk Fires Back After Billie Eilish Calls Him a ‚ÄòCoward' for Wealth Hoarding		
	









	
	
		
					Jon Stewart Questions Trump References in Epstein Emails: ‚ÄòWhich Bubba Was He Blowing?'		
	









	
	
		
					Selena Quintanilla's Autopsy Report Revealed 30 Years After Her Death		
	









	
	
		
					‚ÄòWeird Al' Yankovic Announces 90-Date ‚ÄòBigger & Weirder' 2026 Tour		
	









	‚ÄúIt's interesting from a language point of view because it has made the transition from an academic term to one used by ordinary people in their social media posts,‚Äù Colin McIntosh, Cambridge Dictionary Chief Editor, said in the report. ‚ÄúAnd it also captures the zeitgeist of 2025, as the public's fascination with celebrities and their lifestyles continues to reach new heights.‚Äù


	Earlier this year, Cambridge Dictionary added ‚ÄúSkibidi,‚Äù ‚ÄúTradwife,‚Äù and ‚ÄúDelulu‚Äù to its lexicon. Looking ahead, the report concludes, it will also be keeping an eye on ‚ÄúGlazing,‚Äù ‚ÄúVibey,‚Äù and ‚ÄúBias,‚Äù as in the term for ‚Äúthe object of a fan's stanning‚Äù as popularized by K-Pop fans. 

We want to hear it. Send us a tip using our anonymous form.

Title: UFO Footage: Anna Paulina Luna Asks Why Data Is Hiding Under Black Congressional Budget
Description:
US Representative Anna Paulina Luna has intensified her push for transparency around UFO and UAP programmes, alleging that critical footage and data are being concealed under a classified 'black congressional budget.'

Luna, who chairs the House Task Force on the Declassification of Federal Secrets, argues that lawmakers and taxpayers are being shut out of programmes that may involve advanced aircraft and unexplained phenomena.

Her comments, made during interviews with The Joe Rogan Experience, FOX 13 Tampa Bay, and the Hindustan Times, have reignited debate over how the US government handles sensitive UAP material ‚Äî and whether elected officials truly have oversight.

Luna told Joe Rogan that she has viewed classified photographs inside a secure federal facility, claiming the objects depicted were 'not made by mankind.' She said whistle-blowers and military personnel have repeatedly described encounters with craft capable of manoeuvres that defy physics.

Several sources, she insisted, referred to the operators of these craft as 'interdimensional beings' ‚Äî entities capable of moving 'outside of time and space.'

Luna clarified that she has not seen aliens or open portals herself, but said: 'I have seen photographic evidence in a SCIF, where I was briefed.' She suggested that descriptions from ancient texts, including missing biblical writings, may echo similar encounters.

She argues that congressional oversight is being obstructed by limited access to both the data and funding behind these projects, according to Hindustan Times.

In an interview with FOX‚ÄØ13 Tampa Bay, Luna pressed: 'Why can't we see some of these classified videos and information that seem to be operating under a black Congressional budget? ... Congress is not being given access to money that we're spending.'

She added that the lack of access is both a national security and democratic accountability issue: 'If these are programs ... responsible for ... billions of dollars being lost ... that could be going towards other things.'

Luna described questioning whistle-blowers and military personnel about the unknown craft, and she recounted that 'the repeated answer was that these were interdimensional beings‚Äîthey defy conventional physics.'

She emphasised caution, clarifying, 'I have never seen a portal open or a full alien spaceship, but I have seen photographic evidence in a secure, compartmented information facility, where I was briefed.'

She suggested a possible link between ancient texts and modern phenomena, asserting that '[descriptions in the missing books of the Bible] may echo the encounters I'm investigating.'

Luna recounted a confrontation at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida, saying that "despite being on a congressional delegation, we were denied access to pilots and evidence."

She claimed the base commander cited insufficient security authorisation. Luna said she challenged the commander, insisting that as elected officials, they are entitled to oversight.

Luna's push for declassification is not without controversy. She has expressed frustration with the Pentagon and intelligence agencies, asserting that a 'protective complex' exists to keep these phenomena secret.

Yet she remains determined, calling for more congressional hearings, oversight, and public accountability. Her stated goals are 'to prove that humans are not alone, and to ensure taxpayers know how money is being used in highly secretive defence programmes.'

As the debate over UAP disclosure intensifies, Luna's demands spotlight the ongoing tension between national security and democratic transparency, raising questions that extend far beyond Capitol Hill.

Title: Theatre Review: "Paranormal Activity" Takes Live Theater to Scary New Heights
Description:
The iconic horror franchise gets a theatrical makeover in the spooky stage play Paranormal Activity. This new story mirrors the style, structure, and escalating dread of the six-film series. But make no mistake: while there's an emotional spine holding the narrative together, it's the special effects designed by illusionist Chris Fisher (the mastermind behind the jaw-dropping moments in Stranger Things: The First Shadow and Harry Potter and the Cursed Child) that audiences will be buzzing about long after they've exited the theater. This production is built on ‚Äúhow did they do THAT?‚Äù energy, and it delivers.

The plot centers on Lou (Cher Alvarez) and James (Patrick Heusinger), an American couple who've just relocated to London for James's job. They've been placed in a lovely craftsman-style home, the sort of quaint London dwelling that practically begs to be haunted. And as far as Lou is concerned, there's already enough to deal with. They're putting an ocean between themselves and James's mother, Carolanne, played by Shannon Cochran, with an enjoyably meddling edge. (And yes, naming her after ‚ÄúCarolanne‚Äù is a delightful wink to Poltergeist.)



Carolanne's anxiety isn't entirely unwarranted. There's a history with Lou's mental health, a series of incidents back in Chicago that still cast a shadow. But Lou insists she's fine, and for a brief moment, the newly arrived couple actually believes they're about to embark on a fresh start.

Then the creepy stuff begins.

At first, it's the small things: power outages, water faucets turning on by themselves, doors that refuse to stay closed. But as Lou becomes convinced something supernatural is inside the house ‚Äì and as James tries very, very hard to be the rational one ‚Äì the audience watches their grip on reality begin to slip. Once James finally accepts that something is happening, they call in the wonderfully quirky ghost-hunting podcaster Etheline Cotgrave (Kate Fry). Let's just say her visit doesn't go well, and the haunting escalates into a full-force assault. Along the way, the couple's buried secrets snap to the surface, offering clues to who or what might be tormenting their home.

To be clear, the story of Paranormal Activity isn't breaking new ground. A couple moves into a house. Weird things occur. Trauma resurfaces. Something sinister demands attention. It's Horror 101. But seeing this kind of story unfold live gives it a fresh charge. One of the defining traits of the films is the found-footage style that encourages audiences to scan every corner for a flicker of movement. The stage production cleverly replicates that feeling. With Gareth Fry's sound design building the franchise's signature low, ominous rumble (the audio clue that a scare is coming), the entire house set becomes a minefield of suspense. The two-story design ensures the audience's eyes are constantly darting, trying to anticipate which hallway, staircase, or shadowy nook will erupt next.



And many of those moments truly land. The audience I saw it with screamed, gasped, clutched strangers, and occasionally laughed just to release the tension. I won't spoil a single effect, but several of them are as impressive as anything I've seen in a Broadway-scale thriller.

As directed by Felix Barrett (Sleep No More) and restaged by the show's playwright Levi Holloway (The Grey House), the pacing is tight, the atmosphere immersive, and the commitment to the franchise's tone surprisingly faithful. There are, however, a few drawbacks. The actors' volume is often so low that major plot points get swallowed, perhaps intentionally, to make the audience lean in before a scare hits with a jump-worthy jolt. Effective, yes, but occasionally frustrating. (This tactic was used purposely in the horror classic The Exorcist.)  The second act is also dimly lit to the point of murkiness, which contributes to the mood but sometimes makes it difficult to see who's where and what's happening.

Still, those issues don't sink the production. If anything, they feel like growing pains for a show experimenting with how far live theater can push 21st-century horror. And as someone who genuinely loves the Paranormal Activity films, I wasn't convinced the franchise would translate to a stage. Turns out, it absolutely does.

For fans of the movies, this is a must-see. For theatergoers looking for something different, atmospheric, and seasonally spooky, this is a wildly entertaining night out. Paranormal Activity isn't just a theatrical adaptation; it's a reminder that live theater, with the right team, can still find thrilling new ways to make an entire audience jump out of their seats.
